result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip L Kalwitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full with cash bond.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

C: Defendant, DOC

Defendant Phillip L Kalwitz in court with attorney Sarah A Clark.  
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters guilty plea to 16CM129 and 16CM222. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders sentence withheld, Probation 2 years, concurrent. 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system 
- 5 days jail (16CM222), consecutive to 16CT82 
- Huber/work release privileges granted 
- 30 hours CSW (16CM129) 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Status conference on September 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Per Br. 1, rescheduling
